bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Richard Aldington was born July 8, 1892. During his long career as a poet, critic, translator, and biographer, he authored more than 70 works. His novels included: Death of a Hero (1929), All Men are Enemies (1933), and Women Must Work (1934). He died in July 1962, shortly after his 70th birthday.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of two typescripts--one the original and the other a carbon--both revised, of Aldington's Women Must Work (1934).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: A bound text with the revised typescript followed by the revised carbons.
